column2: Many people gathered at Abhayagiri on June 4, 2016, to meet old friends, celebrate and share reflections. Some sessions are not currently included pending teacher consent.

column6: Closing Remarks by Ajahn Pasanno
Text
This is what heat is like.
Ajahn Pasanno attends Dharma Master Heng Lyu's ordination.
Background of the 20th Anniversary celebration.|| Explained by {teachers}.
A monastery isn't the buildings or the land, but it's the people.
Ajahn Pasanno's first impressions of Wat Pah Pong.
Ajahn Pasanno's motivations for moving to Abhayagiri; twenty years went by quick.
Explanation of paritta chanting.
Abhayagiri's neighbors and origins of the Abhayagiri property.
[Ajahn Pasanno](teacher:) expresses gratitude to the Saṅghapāla board members.
Reflections from Reverend Heng Sure.
[Ajahn Pasanno](teacher:) introduces Ajahn Mahā Prasert.
Laying the foundations for inner happiness. (Thai)
Laying the foundations for inner happiness.
The relationship between Abhayagiri and The City of Ten Thousand Buddhas.
Master Hua invites Ajahn Sumedho to be the precept master for an ordination at The City of Ten Thousand Buddhas
The friendship between disciples of Ajahn Chah and the disciples of Master Hua.
SN 45.2: Half of the Holy Life.
Master Xuanzang writes that the Abhayagiri Vihara has "Mahāyana Theravādins."
Heng Shun meets Ajahn Pasanno at Wat Phleng Vipassanā in 1973.
Heng Shun visits Ajahn Chah.
[Venerable Father]().
"Very imposing, very strict, very straightforward, and very challenging." — Heng Shun describes Ajahn Chah
Ajahn Sumedho meets Master Hua.
Dharma Master Heng Shun meets Ajahn Pasanno at Wat Pah Nanachat.
More details about the 1991 City of Ten Thousand Buddhas ordination.
about the friendship between The City of Ten Thousand Buddhas and Abhayagiri.
Dharma Master Heng Shun teaches his students to recite the Mata Sutta (SN 15.14-19) before meditation.
The friendship between Abhayagiri and Holy Transfiguration Monastery (Mount Tabor).
Father Damien's first visit to The City of Ten Thousand Buddhas.
Sharing the mountain together.
Father Boniface meets Ajahn Sumedho: "It's not good to have two roosters on the same dung heap."
Father Damien explains the icon given to him by Abhayagiri monks.
The monks of Holy Transfiguration Monastery sing a blessing; Ajahn Pasanno expresses appreciation.
How I came to Buddhism and the beginnings of the Saṅghapāla Foundation.
Coming to Buddhism through the AIDS crisis.
Offering food to monks and board members; joining the Saṅghapāla Foundation.
The first seven years of the Saṅghapāla Foundation.
Meeting Buddhism in Thailand and becoming a Saṅghapāla board member.
Saṅghapāla Foundation and the beginnings of Abhayagiri Monastery.
Meeting Buddhism in Thailand and San Francisco.
At that time, Saṅghapāla board members were selected among the three people who would regularly attend sittings, so if you attended more than two sittings, you were basically a board member.
Accepting donations for the purchase of Abhayagiri's land; resolving a conflict on the board.

[Bhikkhu Adhikaraṇasamatha 7](https://suttacentral.net/pli-tv-bu-vb-as1-7/en/brahmali?lang=en&layout=plain&reference=none&notes=asterisk&highlight=false&script=latin): Covering over as with grass; discussion in [_The Buddhist Monastic Code_](https://www.dhammatalks.org/vinaya/bmc/Section0027.html#As7).
on the growth of Abhayagiri.
It takes a global village to create a monastery.
on Buddhism and psychotherapy.
I am loved by many people at Abhayagiri.
SN 45.2: Half of the Holy Life.
"No BS that I can note."
[Four Noble Truths]().
The monastery comes to our doorstep.
The first anagārika ordained on Abhayagiri property returns.
A life-changing Dhamma talk.
Inviting monks to California to start a monastery.
Ajahn Sucitto's explanation of saṅghakamma redefines the focus of Saṅghapāla Foundation.
The best investment I ever made.
{teachers} introduces Ajahn Karuṇadhammo.
What we take with us.
Gratitude to Joseph Kappel.
The qualities of the heart are what really matters.
This is a broken glass.|Ajahn Chah
Ajahn Amaro hears of Master Hsuan Hua through Ajahn Sumedho.
I always thought I would never meet anyone else like Luang Por Chah, but I just met another one.|Ajahn Sumedho
Ajahn Sumedho asks Ajahn Amaro to go to California.
The virtual monastery in San Francisco.
Ajahn Sumedho delays the opening of a San Francisco vihara in 1992.
Master Hua offers land to Ajahn Sumedho the day after the Elders' Council approves a land search.
It had been the dream of my life to bring the Northern and Southern Traditions together again, and I never thought I was going to be able to do it until I met Sumedho.|Master Hsuan Hua
Testing times: Saṅghapāla Foundation scrambles to purchase the plot of land adjacent to Master Hsuan Hua's gift.||Recollected by {teachers}.
Moving onto the Abhayagiri land.
Abhayagiri 20 years later.
Origins of the Abhayagiri co-abbotship.
You can't have two tigers living in the same cave.|Ajahn Mahā Prasert
The connection with Ajahn Mahā Prasert and Casa Serena.
The world of things we leave behind, but the qualities of the heart are the abiding refuge.
The Sharing of Blessings (Chanting Book p. 33).
Closing Homage (Chanting Book p. 16).
